column4: actually a .lnk file isn't really quite the right analogy - and windows has real symbolic links since like NT4
oh, i didn't know that, in fact, i heard windows has true hardlinks also but they're buggy since no one cares about them
yeah, i do see the difference between a unix softlink and a windows .lnk, but for the sake of explaining to a user, i'd say they pretty much server the same function
yes, in fact, all files are hard links...most with a link count of 1
